newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romanian forex dealers say central bank intervenes.
newsitem.headline: Romanian forex dealers say central bank intervenes.

text.p: Romanian foreign exchange traders said on Friday the central bank (BNR) was intervening by selling and buying dollars in a bid to drain liquidity and prop up the local leu currency.
"The BNR is in the market now. It sold dollars and drew leu liquidity," one dealer with a private bank told Reuters.
Another trader said he had sold dollars to the BNR: "It (BNR) bought dollars from me. The market is a hectic now, and I don't know what the BNR plans to do."
Central bank officials were not available for comment.
